resources.string: View AppVerifier\'s source code on the GitHub website in your web browser
View AppVerifier\'s privacy policy in app
View open source licenses of code that AppVerifier uses in app
Replaces background with pitch black background when dark theme is on
Open AppVerifier\'s website in your web browser
Review AppVerifier\'s privacy policy and license (scroll down)

AppVerifier privacy policy

This app makes no internet connections, and does not store any data other than preferences. This app can see which apps are installed on your device for the purpose of viewing and verifying their signing certificate's validity. You can share and copy the package name and hash of an app's signing certificate to other apps using the share/copy button and also verify the package name and hash by pasting from your clipboard or sharing the verification info received from others to this app. The clipboard content is not stored and is only used to calculate if the given package name and hash matches with the one you are verifying against. The content shared to this app is not stored and is only used to calculate if the given package name and hash matches with the one you are verifying against.

AppVerifier's privacy policy may be updated from time to time. When it does, you will be prompted to accept the new policy upon opening the app.

Last updated: December 24, 2023.
